website_summaries.verdict: Designed for loose leaf tea, this long-necked infuser keeps your fingers out of hot water. And you can use the device to stir, too.
pros: Ball segment slides open, making it easy to fill
Long neck will fit in most mugs
Easy to clean, long handle prevents finger burns
Can use the infuser to stir your tea, too
cons: Small gaps on sides can allow small tea leaf pieces to escape

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't that great.
customer_reviews.text: The design of the ball and the handle that opens/closes the ball is a nice idea but there were some flaws. It barely brewed the leaves. I put 2 teaspoons into the ball and it didn't give my tea much flavor. When I opened the ball up to empty the used leaves half of them were still dry. Also I had many leaves leak out of the ball, not really sure how that happened since it seems pretty closed up once you turn it shut. I would not recommend this for someone looking to get the most out of their brew.
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla M

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Does not keep tea inside even though I had it shut completely and was using a very coarse tea blend. Very disappointed because it’s a cool design in that it doubles as a stirrer and is long for a large tumbler. However it’s most important job of keeping the tea bits out of your water it totally fails at
customer_reviews.author: Kelly M. Pettersen

customer_reviews.title: Effective
customer_reviews.text: Got this one over others because it effectively keeps the tea in. I do have one tea that is finer and if i swish the infuser around int the water it does cause much of the finer tea to escape but for that tea i simply let it rest and gently bob if necessary. I did drop it once right after getting it and the little pin holding the two sides together at the top popped out and wouldnt go back in. I was angry at this at first for how fragile it was but the pin isnt actually necessary and i have continued to use the infuser with it opening and closing with absolutely no issue.
customer_reviews.author: M.E.

customer_reviews.title: OXO Nails it Again
customer_reviews.text: I keep looking for just the right tool for my morning and evening cups of tea. I probably have too many, but none have felt quite right - I think I have finally found it. Just the right size and really well made. VERY easy to clean (just twist it back and forth a few times). Great for long leaf teas (and all teas). Very handy. I have recommended it to friends, as well.
customer_reviews.author: Bolo Jungle

customer_reviews.title: Cute & Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: Super cute and easy to use. It turns very smoothly and unless your tea leaves are the super tiny powered pieces, it holds the tea leaves fairly well. Of course this is in comparison to my cheap tea pod from Ikea that leaked a bunch of random leaves out... this holds it all in very well. The material is nice and smooth.
customer_reviews.author: NYCS

customer_reviews.title: Sufficient
customer_reviews.text: You may get a few small pieces of tea in your cup, but gravity takes them straight to the bottom. Why the leaves? Because where the two halves meet is where the tea leaves come out. It does take some stirring to make the tea as the holes are maybe a little too small. But, all and all Its sufficient for my needs and makes for a quick cup. Its a clever design and maybe just needs a little more improvement. 4 stars
customer_reviews.author: David May

customer_reviews.title: Updated review: Did not last two weeks
customer_reviews.text: I had originally given this product 5 stars. See original review below. But after less than two weeks, the spinning mechanism just stopped working, making the product unusable. So, while I liked this product, it clearly is not worth the cost as it does not last. Original review: I just made the switch to loose leaf and this product works well. It keeps the bits out of the tea better than a different style I have tried that does not close as tightly.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: + Solid construction, it has lasted me several years now + Grip feels good in the hand and is easy to use + Stem is long enough to use in most cups - DOES NOT WORK WITH SMALL TEA LEAVES! Only use it for medium/large leaves. Smaller leaves will seep through into the cup 4/5 - Works well as long as you do not use it with very fine tea. I hope this review helps!
customer_reviews.author: Dove Family

customer_reviews.title: Fine particles seep out of infuser
customer_reviews.text: The mechanism to open and close the ball works well. I used it with a Teavana tea called Jasmine Dragon Phoenix with Peach Tranquility. I didn't expect to see so many fine tea particles escape from this infuser. I needed to strain away the floating pieces.It helped to create a flavorful cup of tea, but the floating pieces were a hassle. It may work better with tea composed of larger leaves and fruits.
customer_reviews.author: Jill R.

customer_reviews.title: Using it daily
customer_reviews.text: So easy to fill, easy to use -- I've been enjoying hot tea every day thanks to this. And I like that I'm creating less waste by buying bulk tea leaves in less packaging. It's not hard to clean, but occasionally a couple leaves get stuck inside and it can be awkward getting them out since the two pieces of the ball don't come apart (at least, I don't think they do!)
customer_reviews.author: Kellie G

customer_reviews.title: but I'm annoyed to have to toss it after only a couple ...
customer_reviews.text: There are three problems with this device: 1. The handle isn't long enough to use in a travel mug 2. It doesn't hold enough tea for something more than a standard 8-10oz mug 3. Wet tea expands, making it hard to open the ball. Doing so strips out the mechanism, and then it's junk. This wasn't the most expensive purchase I've ever made, but I'm annoyed to have to toss it after only a couple months. #3 happened to me, and there's no way to fix it. The handle spins, but it doesn't open. One of those standard basket things from the grocery store would've lasted longer and been cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Arnold Irving

customer_reviews.title: Best tea ball/infuser!
customer_reviews.text: Best tea ball/infuser I've found! I've tried the "spoon" style infusers, as well as the ball type with a metal chain, and have never been happy with them. This one is perfect! The twisting mechanism to open the ball operates smoothly, and the entire item has the feeling of being sturdy and well-made. Additionally, I have limited use of one arm/hand, and this is the easiest infuser for me to use. This infuser can be twisted open easily and set on a flat surface to fill with tea, then easily twisted to close. It is also easy to empty and rinse, and seems to be holding up well with regular use.
customer_reviews.author: CL

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't strain well
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately bought 2 and disposed of packaging before realizing they let all small particles through the holes. After making most teas, I had to fish out particles from the top of the glass that escaped through the holes. Not sure if all tea balls are like this, but would only be useful for larger leaf teas without smaller herbs.
customer_reviews.author: Joan Cestaro

customer_reviews.title: Might as well just open your bag of tea and pour it directly into your face.
customer_reviews.text: There's a considerable gap on both sides of the ball that leads to loose tea leaking out. Oxo products are typically well made, so I am disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: jtrumpio

customer_reviews.title: Not so easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: It works well and it is very easy to use, specially because all you do is twist the stick and it opens and closes the device. However, it’s not the easiest to clean since some small leaves slips under the other side when opening making me open and close multiple times to get it completely clean when hand washing it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice little tool!
customer_reviews.text: It is nice and simple, it uses about 2 teaspoons of loose tea. Just a twist with the handle and it opens and closed. Rinsing out the container is easy.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Skopczynski

customer_reviews.title: Handy Tea Steeper
customer_reviews.text: Being an avid tea drinker, this steeper really comes handy. Quick and easy to use, no mess. I have two of these and bought a few more fro family members who drinks tea. Cants go wrong with this product. NOTE: My first one is about 5 years old and still works flawlessly. Thank you OXO
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really useful and smart design
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know if it’s the tea leaves or if it’s the ball, but I’ve only used this for peppermint tea leaves that are pretty tiny and it doesn’t do too well. The leaves will eventually float out of the ball and if have to strain the tea again. Maybe it’s the leaves but maybe it’s the way the ball twists, so the opening lets the leaves float out. I am not sure yet, but so far even with this happening, I wouldn’t use a different infuser. Great buy, definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: nice upgrade from old infusers
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I bought in as many months. My wife keeps using mine all the time because she just loves it. So much easier to use than the old school infusers. Very easy to clean. All you have to do is just twist the top and that's it. Does not open by itself, so you will never have tea leaves inside your cup. Absolutely love it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Vaynshteyn

customer_reviews.title: wonderful for loose leaf
customer_reviews.text: Wow this thing is ingenious. I love loose leaf tea (check out Upton Tea online for great loose-leaf teas), but I don't like going through disposable tea filters, and it's hard to find a good standard tea ball. Somehow they all rust or fall apart really quickly. This thing is amazing. You can scoop the tea up in it and then use it to stir while you steep. Fairly easy to clean. Every once in a while I get a tea leaf stuck between the two layers but that just requires some twisting and more rinsing. Super easy to take care of, and after many cups of tea it's still good as new.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Great design & made well.
customer_reviews.text: I have used it numerous times these last few months and find this tea ball a lot easier to use than the ones you dip in with a metal chain. With 1 simple turning motion, I found it easy to scoop up loose leaf tea and extremely easy to clean. It is also nice that while it is submerged in water, you can stir. No rusting or broken parts yet. I find the turning motion much easier to use than other competitor tea ball sticks which require you to push the knob downward like a syringe.
customer_reviews.author: Romeo

customer_reviews.title: Easy to open and close, looks nice
customer_reviews.text: These are super convenient to use for loose leaf. I bought extra to replace my old spoons that aren’t as easy to use or clean. These don’t require you to squeeze a handle to open. It’s really easy. Would be helpful for people with arthritis, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca I.

customer_reviews.title: Great for large tea leaf not fine
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this infuser. The holes are big and my tea ends up floating in my cup and not staying in the infuser. If you use large leaf tea, then by all means this is the tool. Wish Oxo would make this in a fine/extra fine mesh.
customer_reviews.author: A P

customer_reviews.title: I knew it was too good to be true. Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Leaks loose tea in your cup. I ended up getting the muslin tea bags and nothing but liquid gets through those bags. DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.author: SouthernBomb

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but the holes are too large
customer_reviews.text: Because the holes are too large small particles of tea go through the ball and into your tea. Too bad because mechanically this is a great idea.
customer_reviews.author: Che Kerouac

customer_reviews.title: Very nice design for preparation & easy cleanup
customer_reviews.text: I really like this type of tea ball. You can clean this one without having to get your hands wet or covered with wet tea, when you want to take a nice hot cup of tea. Yes, it does leave a little tea residue on the bottom of the cup, but personally I'd rather not take the last sip in preference to cleaning wet tea out of the screw-type tea balls.
customer_reviews.author: Wilma608

customer_reviews.title: Easy and fun to use!
customer_reviews.text: Just throw tea leaves there, close the ball, and then watch it brewing. Fun and easy. After use, throw out the leaves. Sometimes, it gets stuck instead the turning ball, yet you will figure out in cleaning them after few uses. I am quite a clean person, and it is hard to wash it completely. However, it is dirty from tea water, and rinsing should be sufficient in cleaning it. I recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Allon

customer_reviews.title: Nice cup of leaves
customer_reviews.text: I decided to give this tea infuser a try even after reading mixed reviews on it. I had hoped that I'd end up with an experience like all of the positive reviewers, but I should have known better. I followed the directions about how much tea to put into the infuser, but there were still many leaves in my tea--and my loose tea leaves are actually on the large side. I'm not one to freak out over a few leaves in my tea, but the amount that came out the infuser was unacceptable. I could have saved my money and poured water over my tea if I wanted to drink a tea slurry. My search for a good infused continues.
customer_reviews.author: A. Gibson

customer_reviews.title: works well. happy with it.
customer_reviews.text: Aesthetically, it looks pretty nice. And it seems to work fairly well. I've been using it to brew clove and ginger tea and the device makes it a breeze to clean up afterwards. I also have a tea ball with a chain handle, which I never used much. The handle and the rotating head makes it easy to brew tea without having to touch the tea powder with your fingers/hands. And when you're done, you can simply dump the contents into the garbage, again without touching the tea powder/leaves.
customer_reviews.author: Gino Lee

customer_reviews.title: OXO does it again!
customer_reviews.text: Clever design for using loose tea. Always able to trust OXO!
customer_reviews.author: TRAM1951

customer_reviews.title: Better than some tea balls; but still not great
customer_reviews.text: I decided to quit coffee and take up tea. And organic tea seemed smartest (so sayeth my doctor). So I bought in loose bulk and bought this tea ball. I've tried the kind that hooks to the rim, but the metal hook gets so hot, I've burned my fingers. So this seemed perfect. Except the holes are quite big and the tea always got loose (could have been the tea itself). The other issue is that it's a pain to clean. You have to really twist and rinse, twist and rinse, to get every tea leaf loose (they get stuck in there). And I found the hassle, not quite worth the tea, in the end.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: Love This Infuser!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried several of this type of infuser for loose tea and most of them leak tea leaves into the tea. This one doesn't. It's also easy to use, fills easily and cleans well too. Definitely a keeper!
customer_reviews.author: Sable

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and easy to clean. I tap the filled ball on the bottom of the cup filled with water to get all the air bubbles out before letting it steep because the holes are so small. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn White

customer_reviews.title: OXO BREW Twisting Tea Ball Infuser
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several Tea Ball Infusers as well as disposable tea bags. The OXO BREW Twisting Tea Ball Infuser is by far the best Tea Infuser I have used/purchased! I am purchasing an additional OXO BREW Twisting Tea Ball Infuser. Most importanly, the tea taste delicious A+
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to like this!
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to use this to steep my newly purchased loose teas. I was immediately disappointed when I saw tea particles in my mug. This tool is very easy to clean and works fine for the most part, but needs to be a tight fit when closed to prevent particles from getting into the water. On the lookout for a better design.
customer_reviews.author: VNM

customer_reviews.title: Leaves everywhere
customer_reviews.text: If you like loose leaf tea in your teacup this is the infuser for you. I am not one of those people (despite using very large black tea). I would like to return this product but I'm not sure that's an option now that its been used.
customer_reviews.author: ritz

customer_reviews.title: I Like This
customer_reviews.text: Used several different styles of tea infusers over the years. This is my current favorite. Works smoothly and does the job well. I recommend this for anyone who brews loose tea by the cup.
customer_reviews.author: Ken King

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: This item enables you to use loose leaf tea on an individual cup basis. Considering the price point: the workmanship is acceptable, functionality is excellent, and materials seems acceptable. I clean mine promptly but have forgotten it in a cup now and then and the item appears used but not rusted or tarnished. Very good if you are looking for value and loose leaf tea for 1 (or two different kinds for a couple).
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Costa

customer_reviews.title: Okay Quality, but nly okay
customer_reviews.text: I like how easy it is to use, but it doesn't "seal" well enough to prevent all of the tea leaves from coming loose into my drink. I bought this so I could drink an herbal peach tea and ,while it prevents the larger pieces from slipping into my mug, it does little for the smaller bits. Also the turning mechanism in the handle has started to become loose after consistent use after a couple weeks. When I clean, I need to use individual scrub brush bristles to clean the individual holes. Overall, don't think I would recommend this or buy again, though I am not so dissatisfied that I am going to prematurely throw it out.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: I use it for decoration, it’s amazing.
customer_reviews.text: I LOOOOVE THIS! If you’re a pastry chef GET IT. I don’t precisely use it for tea, I sill use it to sift things... like decorate with powder sugar, cocoa powder or spices such as cinnamon. Amazing product
customer_reviews.author: Ana Dominguez

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Loose Leaf Teas...
customer_reviews.text: This is a must for anyone who drinks loose leaf teas. Very convenient! Just scoop the loose leaf tea into the tea ball and twist the end to close it, then submerge into your cup with hot water and let it steep. I love how I can stir this tea ball and hurry along the steeping process. Clean up is a breeze, just twist the end and it opens, allowing you to dump the used tea into the compose bin or garbage. It is also dishwasher safe...
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Morris

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Great for everyday use. Wish it was a bit bigger. Cleaning can sometimes be tough due to the tea leaves getting stuck betwen the 2 semi-circles when they overlap. Besides that this is by far the easiest way to steep loose tea.
customer_reviews.author: A.U.

customer_reviews.title: broke after 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: This worked fine until it broke after about 2 weeks (doesn't stay shut and the seeds fall out into the water). I now have to buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: MBR

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution for loose leaf teas
customer_reviews.text: I have never been disappointed in the quality of any OXO products. Is is around my fourth or fifth OXO product, and is incredibly useful when you just want a single cup of tea. All of the leaves stay in the ball, and acts as a stirring stick. The only thing that could be better is using a French press to make tea, but then it requires more washing. Highly recommended. If you found this review to be helpful, please click the "Yes" button below. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Chaz Curtis

customer_reviews.title: I love this tea ball
customer_reviews.text: I love this tea ball. It is the best tea ball I've ever used and is so easy to use. With most tea balls that I've had, many of the tea leaves slip out and then float on the top of the tea cup. It is annoying to have to remove them. With this Oxo tea ball, I have not encountered that problem at all. I plan to get another one. Thank you OXO.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Mac

customer_reviews.title: Solid concept , very portable, but leaves more sediment in the cup.
customer_reviews.text: This is a neat concept however the unit kept losing some of the finer pieces of tea in the gap where it closes which left significant sediment in the cup. So I would not recommend it if you do not have consistently large pieces of leaf in there. In my case this was replaced for travel duty with the Khaw-Fee unit which works great.
customer_reviews.author: Just Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great if you love chewing you tea!
customer_reviews.text: This leaked tea leaves horribly. I was very disappointed as I do not prefer to chew my tea. I purchased disposable tea bags and they worked much better!
customer_reviews.author: Amber S

customer_reviews.title: Gifted to family member
customer_reviews.text: We love the way the water can flow through this - much more practical than some other tea leaf holders I'd bought. Excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M. B.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice utensil
customer_reviews.text: This infuser is handy. I recommend it to anyone who enjoys quality loose leaf teas. I have no complaints about it or it's usefulness.
customer_reviews.author: BM89

customer_reviews.title: Good, not great
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, it's easy to close it in such a way that tea falls out while it's steeping. Product designers could fix that easily by not making it essentially two half-circles, but one half-circle and one that's 2/3. This would ensure that when closed, even if not perfectly aligned, there wouldn't be a way for loose tea to fall out into the water.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Matthews

customer_reviews.title: Works super
customer_reviews.text: Great tea ball. I don't usually use loose tea, but the mechanism of this tea ball is sure to keep the loose stuff inside and just let out the color and flavors. I hate it when bits of leaves and such are floating around your drink. and this ball keep that from happening. The closure is tight and the twisting works easily. Great value for the money. I buy lots of Oxo products, and as with all that I've purchased, this one did not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: S. L. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Quality tea infuser
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to make teas. Such a great product, easy to use and clean and your teas do not come through the infuser. Would purchase again and do recommend purchasing it. Quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Michigan City, IN

customer_reviews.title: Best tea infuser ever.
customer_reviews.text: This is so easy to use and clean. It's not messy at all to fill and empty. I will never use any other tea infuser.
customer_reviews.author: Jane L. Dough

customer_reviews.title: Very well made
customer_reviews.text: I have used this twice a day for well over a year. I had to search it here to write a review. I am so impressed with how sturdy it is. When open it, I hit it on the side of the bin so knock the tea out. I love it. Very well made product. **Update: I have now used this product for 2 and a half years and it still functions perfectly..I had to find my review because i am really impressed that the mechanism has not loosened a bit. and I constantly smack it on the side of the trash bin to knock out the green tea that is in it once I am finished infusing.
customer_reviews.author: J. White

customer_reviews.title: Slightly gappy but I love it
customer_reviews.text: It’s a little gappy for some loose leaf teas so expect some tea dust and debris in the cup (which generally floats to the bottom anyway so it doesn’t bother me). Great quality and fun little mechanism.
customer_reviews.author: The Big Bopper

customer_reviews.title: Really good.
customer_reviews.text: This super easy to clean, and it is large enough that a tablespoon of loose tea has room to brew - it isn't tightly packed in there.
customer_reviews.author: A. D'Acquisto

customer_reviews.title: Great basic tea ball
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this tea ball. Some tea leaves do come out through the holes, which is to be expected, and I really don't think the holes could be much smaller. It's not "cute" like some of the tea diffusers on the market (I have to say, I am a sucker for "cute," and I love the one that looks like a little dude relaxing in your teacup.) However, the function is great. It's easy to scoop loose tea and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: MochaOnyx

customer_reviews.title: This seems like a well made infuser
customer_reviews.text: This seems like a well made infuser. The concept is great and I love all the other OXO products we have... HOWEVER; It didn't work well for the bulk tea we use. The holes are tiny and even after soaking in boiling water in the cup, it didn't get very strong.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than traditional ball infuser
customer_reviews.text: The gf that has 3-4 cups of tea a day loves this infuser way more that the “traditional” ball infusers that use the “spring” mechanism.
customer_reviews.author: J. Franco

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic quality tea infuser
customer_reviews.text: When ordering I was concerned about the twisting mechanism but it works like a charm! Infuses a flavorful, strong cup and quickly rinses clean of brewed leaves. I use it every single day and I think it's going to be a durable kitchen tool. You can fit a lot of tea in the ball, but I've found there's no need to overstuff; I buy Harney and Sons loose leaf tea and a small scoop in this infuser will brew 2 strong cups.
customer_reviews.author: Lillian Barnes

customer_reviews.title: If you like a chunky tea, then its great
customer_reviews.text: The idea and concept of this is great. We bought some loose leaf teas and needed a way to brew it. When we first tried it we scooped up the tea leaves, closed it, and dropped it into the hot water. Sure enough the smaller tea leaf particles started leaking through the gap. We tried several different teas and it happened with every kind. If you don't mind chunky tea, or have a strainer to strain your tea through this would be great. I personally am looking for something a little more practical.
customer_reviews.author: M. White

customer_reviews.title: Great little tool
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect tea infuser. Easy to collect loose trees with, easy to use, easy to clean. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: At least my opinion matters here :)

customer_reviews.title: My favorite tea strainer!
customer_reviews.text: This is now my favorite tea strainer. At first, it's easy to twist it too far, which will release all your tea, because you expect the strainer to lock into place, but it doesn't. Instead, you have to stop twisting when the twisting black tip on the handle lines up. It's really easy and it works like a charm. No escaping tea, and no mess because you use the black tip on the handle to release the tea when you're done and then just rinse it out. It's the best system I've used, and I think I've tried everything!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_products_review

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy & Great! The Best!
customer_reviews.text: Best one I've found so far. Holes are a bit big, but not as bad as a lot of the ones I've seen out there. Plus I stir like crazy, so this thing is super sturdy & awesome! UPDATE: This lasted me 2 1/2 years of daily use, before the metal where the tea ball connects to the rod broke during a washing. I'm buying another today because it's been so useful! :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and well made
customer_reviews.text: This took a long time to write. I was impressed when I first bought it, and used it immediately. I deliberately waited some time before writing a review, because I wanted to give real feedback. This device is really nicely made. Innovative design and easily washed off. Also, measuring loose tea is simple, as is emptying the old tea when you are done with it.
customer_reviews.author: John K

customer_reviews.title: love this thing
customer_reviews.text: This tea infuser is easy to load and easy to empty and clean. It allows you to scoop up the amount you need very easily. Never have found an OXO product I didn't like to date!
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, but leaves detritus in tea and sometimes awkwardto clean.
customer_reviews.text: I am not used to having particulate matter in my tea, and I consider it a failure. For loose leaf tea, I have been using French press brewers of various sizes and a mesh filter basket that drops into your cup. I have never had any bits of leaves make it into my tea. As for cleaning, sometimes a leaf or two will get caught between the halves and become awkward to clean out. But the steel itself doesn't hold a residue or flavor, and so I just rinse it most of the time. As with most OXO items, it is easy to use and ergonomic. But I don't want tea leaf dust in my tea.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: So practical and cute. Just be careful when you have to turn it around. Works very well I’m glad I purchase it it’s very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Mare

customer_reviews.title: Best one so far
customer_reviews.text: This works very well. Very easy to load, seal, and empty to clean. The seal is good and tea leaves do not slip out into your tea.
customer_reviews.author: Arv

customer_reviews.title: Nice product overall
customer_reviews.text: Nice product overall. Twists well, and the simpel design is great.... but I've found that the holes are not fine enough for the loose teas I drink. I get a lot of little particles in my teas. They eventually settle, so it's fine, but a small annoyance.
customer_reviews.author: I. Melon

customer_reviews.title: Tea Flecks EVERYWHERE!!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible! Tea flecks leaked out all over the mug! The holes are tiny, so that’s not the issue. It’s the point where the two halves meet that isn’t a tight seal. Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: TR

customer_reviews.title: Nice but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed to see that smaller bits of herbs and teas leak through the ball and end up in the cup. I was also disappointed that it doesn't quite hold a tblsp. of tea or herbs and that filling it up causes a problem with closing it. I am still giving it 4* because it is very well made and I like the way that it opens and closes. It works the best with larger bits of herbs and teas and when you don't fill it up. It is very easy to clean and I like the long handle very much. It makes it very easy to remove it from your cup that way.
customer_reviews.author: A. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Great product, I have four
customer_reviews.text: This is a great design, and quality product. I have four of these, I use them every day and have only had a slight issue with one. Also, the customer service from OXO is great. I contacted them about he one that I had an issue with, and they sent a new one free of charge. I definitely recommend this for anyone looking for a good tea ball infuser.

customer_reviews.title: Tea Time

If you try to use this with a tea containing really fine particles they always wind up floating on top of your tea.

product_meta.title: OXO BREW Twisting Tea Ball Infuser
product_meta.description:
OXO GOOD GRIPS TEA BALL: 
Loose leaf tea just got a lot less complicated. The OXO Good Grips Twisting Tea Ball makes it easy to scoop up the desired amount of loose leaf tea. The twisting feature ensures that a generous amount of tea leaves stays inside the Ball while you close it. The spinning design also makes the Tea Ball easy to clean. The Twisting Tea Ball has a long, stainless steel neck to accommodate many different sizes of mugs and cups, and the soft, non-slip grip makes stirring comfortable. The Twisting Tea Ball is also great for steeping herbs and spices. 

 IT’S THE LITTLE THINGS: 
At OXO, we consistently develop products that address even the tiniest of pet peeves, because we know it’s the little things that make the biggest difference. Sometimes at OXO, tools are introduced because they are the pet projects of our employees. OXO’s president, Alex Lee, is an avid tea drinker and encouraged the development of our Tea Ball. Each detail, even the shape of the holes, was carefully thought out over five years of development. The result? A Tea Ball that has quickly become a favorite of tea enthusiasts everywhere.

FEATURES & BENEFITS:
Scoop: Generous head and twisting feature makes filling the Tea Ball with a large amount loose leaf tea a breeze Steep: Long, stainless steel neck accommodates most cups and mugs for convenient stirring; length also allows it to rest on the side of mugs for prolonged steeping Comfort: Soft, non-slip grip on handle makes twisting and stirring easy and comfortable Cleaning: Twisting the bottom of the handle after use self-scoops wet tea leaves from the Tea Ball, making clean up a breeze; dishwasher safe and BPA free 



GOOD TIP: 
The Tea Ball works best with whole-leaf teas, such as pearl teas, full-leaf green teas and large-leaf black teas. Small- or broken-leaf teas are best used with a fine mesh strainer such as the OXO Good Grips 3” Mini Strainer.
